key_points: Schools in Oregon experience multiple threats of violence following the Oxford High School shooting in Michigan.
Rise in "copycat" threats nationwide, impacting students as young as 9.
Arrest made at Willamette High School in Bethel School District for alleged possession of a gun.
Lockdowns and lockouts issued across several schools after various threat reports.
Superintendent of Bethel School District emphasizes taking student reports of threats seriously.
Bethel School District utilizes ALICE protocol for emergency situations.
A need for improved communication with parents during emergencies identified.
Salem-Keizer Public Schools and law enforcement highlight that "hoax threats" are crimes.
Impact of threats on mental health of students, staff, and parents highlighted.
Suggestions for how parents can support their children after a threat or shooting incident.
